description: A recently disclosed vulnerability in the Common Unix Printing System (CUPS) open-source printing system can be exploited by threat actors to launch distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks with a 600x amplification factor. [...]
title: Recently patched CUPS flaw can be used to amplify DDoS attacks

description: Fake trading apps on Google Play and Apple's App Store lure victims into "pig butchering" scams that have a global reach. [...]
title: ‘Pig butchering’ trading apps found on Google Play, App Store

description: The national Dutch police (Politie) says that a state actor was likely behind the data breach it detected last week. [...]
title: Dutch Police: ‘State actor’ likely behind recent data breach

description: Microsoft and the Justice Department have seized over 100 domains used by the Russian ColdRiver hacking group to target United States government employees and nonprofit organizations from Russia and worldwide in spear-phishing attacks. [...]
title: Microsoft and DOJ disrupt Russian FSB hackers' attack infrastructure

description: Approximately 5% of all Adobe Commerce and Magento online stores, or 4,275 in absolute numbers, have been hacked in "CosmicSting" attacks. [...]
title: Over 4,000 Adobe Commerce, Magento shops hacked in CosmicSting attacks

description: Two Chinese nationals were sentenced to prison for scamming Apple out of more than $2.5 million after exchanging over 6,000 counterfeit iPhones for authentic ones. [...]
title: Fraudsters imprisoned for scamming Apple out of 6,000 iPhones

description: During a distributed denial-of-service campaign targeting organizations in the financial services, internet, and telecommunications sectors, volumetric attacks peaked at 3.8 terabits per second, the largest publicly recorded to date. The assault consisted of a "month-long" barrage of more than 100 hyper-volumetric DDoS attacks flood. [...]
title: Cloudflare blocks largest recorded DDoS attack peaking at 3.8Tbps

description: A Linux malware named "perfctl" has been targeting Linux servers and workstations for at least three years, remaining largely undetected through high levels of evasion and the use of rootkits. [...]
title: Linux malware “perfctl” behind years-long cryptomining campaign

description: Utilizing a custom dictionaries helps strengthen your password policies. Learn more from Specops Software about how to build custom dictionaries in your Windows Active Directory password policy. [...]
title: Why your password policy should include a custom dictionary
